results.title: Rock U.S.A. Part 2
results.brief_description: Part two of a two-part series. Presents an overview of rock music throughout America featuring a strange mixture of artists including early footage of Blondie (Debra Harry) and raw and energetic performances by the Dead Boys, Heart, Mother’s Finest and Southside Johnny and the Asbury Jukes.

results.title: Legacy of a dream
results.creator_credit: Richard Kaplan, Martin Luther King Foundation and Richard Kaplan Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at part of the life of Martin Luther King from 1955 to his assassination on 4 April 1968. Provides interviews with his widow and with Congressman Andrew Young, and includes footage of the civil rights campaign led by King; the bus boycotts; the Klu Klux Klan’s violent campaign; the non-violent civil disobedience; the filling of jails with arrested non-violent campaigners; and the huge marches for peace.

results.title: Hirohito: the chrysanthemum throne
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Murray-Brown, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns International
results.brief_description: Examination of the Japanese emperor who, according to Shinto religion, is a direct descendant of the Sun God. Includes footage of Hirohito’s visit to England in 1921 and in the 1960’s; the signing of Japan’s conditions of surrender at the end of the war; and the American occupation after the war. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: New Dawn Ep. 09
results.brief_description: Last in a series of nine animated films on the history of Western Civilization. Concentrates on the war of liberation in Guinea-Bissau during the 1960s and 1970s, suggesting that through solidarity, co-operation and the ‘people’s union’, other Third World countries would be able to get their freedom and dignity. (English version by the Tricontinental Film Center)

results.title: The Night is sinister
results.brief_description: An animated film on the history of Western Civilization. Studies the African nations and those colonies which have gained their independence but not their freedom, centreing in particular on Ghana which is still oppressed. Criticizes the way in which foreign aid is being utilized by the Common Market and multinational corporations. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: The Coming of darkness
results.brief_description: Seventh in a series of nine animated films on the history of Western Civilization. Discusses the two world wars and the events in Germany, Italy, China, Japan and Russia which were contributing factors. Contends that both were capitalist wars in which workers were fighting workers. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Makeshift solutions
results.brief_description: Sixth in a series of nine animated films on the history of western civilization. Looks at the rise of capitalism during the 19th century; examines the formation of trusts, cartels and monopolies; and discusses the use of cheap labour and cheap raw materials.

results.title: The History book. 5. Triumphant symphony
results.creator_credit: The Film Front and Tricontinental Film Center
results.brief_description:
Fifth in a series of nine animated films on the history of Western Civilization. Looks at the Industrial Revolution and some of its effects: the movement of people into the cities; the use of child labour; the exploitation of workers; the movement of capitalists into parliament to further their own interests and their use of police to quell the workers’ complaints; and the development of monopolies. English version by Tricontinental Film Center.
Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Bloody schemes
results.creator_credit: The Film Front and Tricontinental Film Center
results.brief_description: Fourth in a series of nine animated films on the history of Western Civilization. Closely examines the slave trade: John Hawkyns’ role in starting the trade and its subsequent expansion over the next few hundred years. Explains the trade triangle that existed between Africa, America and Europe. Suitable for lower secondary level.
